title: Here's why the HBO series is so true to the book:
review: first, the book's author, george r.r. martin, was very much involved (as series writer & co, executive producer) in the hbo series' creation (which is likely why it's taken so long for him to release the next book in a song of ice and fire). and second, the serial format is ideal for maintaining fidelity to the spirit of martin's wonderful story. a major challenge faced by the creators of the lord of the rings (lotr) films was the amount of material they had to cull from toliken's epic tale in order to fit into three relatively short films. the serial format provided by hbo eliminates this problem. in fact, nothing would please me more than to see a proper adaptation of lotr filmed in this way. another pleasing aspect of this series is the obvious devotion to quality. by hiring a world class production designer (gemma jackson) and a slate of top-notch english actors, the creators of game of thrones have been able to re-create martin's world in a beautiful and convincing way.

title: One-track mind.
review: game of thrones (an hbo tv series written by george r. r. martin), has clearly been the biggest remarkable achievment on tv of all times, not only because of the plot itself, but also because of how it has been produced, the characters, scenography and the astounding use of technology. in spite of being a fantasy story placed in another time and maybe world, game of thrones breaks all the schemes.as the title of the serie says, got tells the story of a medieval country's civil war. this fictional world presents two continents: westeros and essos in which each of their seven kingdoms leaders, lords or heirs fight in order to claim for the iron throne and rule over the seven kingdoms.before watching the serie, it was like every serie or movie that i've watched didn't leave me with anything. once some credit part ends, my thoughts stayed there, nothing else to think about but got takes everything to the next level. it has the outlandish ability to keep you thinking about it till the next chapter, the next season and so on. each of the seasons have their own particular touch, from the mythical creatures that lurk there, the technology that can make extraordinary scenographies and magic with a computer to the intertwined stories between the characters.if you are the kind of person who likes unthinkable mythical. war and love stories and you are looking for something that wouldn't be out of your mind, then this is your best choice. in spite of being ended now, be ready to sit for hours to watch it. and as someone told me before watching it... don't get attached to anyone, don't choose a side and be ready for the unexpected.

title: Just pretend this...

title: A amazing show ruined by a horrible final season
review:
this show was honestly up there as one of, if not the greatest tv show of all time for the first 6 maybe 7 seasons. then season 8 happened and it became apparent how much dnd butchered the show. my recommendation: watch the first seven seasons then stop there. while seven is definitely not the strongest season, it contains some must watch episodes. just make sure never to watch the 8th season.
8/10

title: Reverse walking dead
review: the main issue with game of thrones is the writers clearly wanted to move on to other projects, namely star wars. were the walking dead has been dragged on for too long, game of thrones fatal mistake was being rushed. season's 1,6 are fantastic up there with the best television ever. 7 was okay, rushed but okay. season 8...season 8. what happened. the ending was so dissapointing. spoiler: jon becoming king although predictable would've been satisfying. but no they thought we don't know how to end it look online copy and paste a plot and done, but bran the weirdo has to come out on top despite being extremely dislikeable.

title: Best TV series ever. 💯
review: between cinematic effect rivaled by even few movies and other elements, i have yet to see a tv series match it or even come close. before game of thrones with the exception of breaking bad and maybe a few other series, very few had kept me glued from beginning to end. it also did what few have done and not only kept you guessing from episode to episode (whether it be who falls in love, who changes from good to evil, who dies, who comes back, new relationships made, old friendships ending and so on)but also built from the first season to the last progressively. it had an extremely grounded, reastic, morbid, grim, brutal, sad, and other negative effects type of storytelling with few bouts of positive triumph, but that's what made it amazing. because the dark moments sure become so much lighter when everything seems to be lost. although many won't approve because of the liberal use of nudity, sexualism, profanity and graphic violence, i defend it wholeheartedly. what in the news and nowadays otherwise is all that much different, at least this one has good writing and equal elements of good. the art direction is impeccable, the writing and acting are perfect across the board, and the visual effects and practical effects are outstanding, especially given this is a tv series and they are better than what most fantasy movies put out. i can't applaud the actors enough, the supporting actors made most lead actors in other series look like amateurs, the leads made most of those in their class look like supporting actors and the good definitely made it easy to cheer for them while the evil were more than capable of carrying out a good effort for people to hate them. if you are into fantasy, medieval, or just good acting entertainment in general and can at least sit through the elements that you consider obscene or over the top, you will love this show , frankly i find it almost impossible to hate it.

title: Greatest Television show ever. The real GOT 💓
review: game of thrones is the best show to ever reach television, and coming from me, that's saying something,trust me. when i first started watching this show i knew i would have to pay close attention as the plot progressed, because i heard it was insanely confusing to keep track of everything; and so, i watched all 8 season 3x over, and now call myself a got expert (that, and because i've read all the books). the plot is exquisite, and the scenery is breathtaking. if you like awe-inspiring shows, in this one, there are an endless amount of "goosebump-giving" scenes where chills run down your back, so that department should be covered. what also makes watching this show so good, is the fact that everyone else has watched it, and now you can talk with them about it! if you wanna be an expert on this show, there at least 100 main characters, so i suggest watching it multiple times over-maybe even reading the books as well.the setting takes place in two fictional land masses; essos, and westeros. most of the show takes place in westeros, where there are a lot (and i mean a lot) of noble houses competing for power (and attempting to get control of the iron throne) with their own armies. some of the noble houses are: the starks, lannisters, baratheon, martells, tyrells, freys, and greyjoys. in essos, we get to see daenerys targaryen (the dragon queen) embark on her journey as she builds up the most massive army the word has ever seen (consisting of dothraki, unsullied, tyrion lannister, and dragons!), to take control in westeros and the iron throne. in westeros however, all the way north, there is an evil force that is now arising after being dormant for thousands of years (the dead/white walkers), and strives to destroy all of mankind.these are a long 8 seasons, but they are worth it, trust me!!

title: Best Show in the 21st Century
review: brilliant, purposeful, and epic! if you like lord of the rings, then you will be in for a ride. character development is heavily emphasized and it is beautifully written across the many seasons in parallel with story arcs. however, season 8 is just ok.

title: A mockery of ASOIAF
review: asoiaf is a genius book,series by grrm, and in my opinion, perhaps the best piece of literature of our century.hbo taking this on was an ambitious attempt, and i have full understanding for some of the compromises made and the fact that they caught up with the books.ultimately i think they should've made the series some 10-20 years later, so they would've been able to ground the show a lot more to the books, and we would have avoided the chaos of post-season 4/5.

title: Nah
review: yes, you can completely ruin a show with a terrible ending, and that is what got will be forever remembered for: the worst final season of all time. an ending so bad, it ruins the rewatchability of the show. let me start off by saying, i was as big of a fan of the show and the books as you could possibly be. i finished the books in 2012, and since have reread most of them. i have watched season 1,6 more times than i even feel comfortable admitting. i wanted to pour my disappointment into a beautifully written polemic, but instead, i am going to put as much effort into the rest of this review as benioff and weiss did into the final season:stupid story, arcs ruined, plots abandoned, rush rush rush, every character takes stupid pills, okay let's wrap this up already, fight fight, cgi, okay we're done. screw you nerds, let's go get that sweet star wars and netflix money.btw, i find it odd people are still doing "spoiler alerts" three months after a series has ended. here is a spoiler alert for you, season 8 spoils the entire series.

title: Easily the greatest show

title: Beautiful show, EPIC ending failure.
review: i hoped to one day share this masterpiece with my kids, until the last season came along. the culmination of intrigue, plot twists, engaging story, and beautiful world all came to an abrupt, shallow, and unfullfilled end.will never watch this series again. i felt like i watched 8 seasons of this for no reason at this point.up to season 7, i encouraged everyone to watch it. now i would not recommend it to anyone due to the complete failure of an ending.

"ask me again in 10 years."

title: Great Show
review: really this is one of the best television shows ever produced. clearly, it is hard to emulate dense novels in screen format, even in long,form, so it does not do that perfectly; however, if you watch it for what it is... a tv show... you will judge it fairly.there is a lot of consternation about the last season. there shouldn't be. all stories come to an end. often suddenly. the end of this series was not only sound, but also satisfying, from a pure story standpoint. i honestly don't understand the backlash. in fact i enjoy re-watching the final season. if you haven't watched the series, do not let the bad reviews of the final season sway your decision to watch this show.

title: Great Start, Bad Finish
review: game of thrones is based off the fantasy novel series, "a song of ice and fire" by the outstanding author george r. r. martin. while the shows first four seasons remain mostly true to the books season five starts to take a different course.david benioff and d. b. weiss who are the show runners, are the main writers and executive produce the show. for this work properly they needed to listen to martin and follow what he had to say. after season 5 they had run out of written material, as the books had not yet been finished. they did have talks with george r. r. martin to see what his point of view on it is and how he wants to end it etc. but it seems they did him an injustice by speeding everything up so they can move on to other projects.a story that use to be unpredictable became very predictable, even if you had read the novels and knew the twist and turns that lied within, it still gives you a shock to see it on the television. but in season five it starts to fade with poor choices. season six remains the same. then seven it all starts to fade. the story no longer starts to make much sense. if you watch it, you will see what i mean. dragons like a jet. finally eight, is just a shocker really. i didn't even know what the show had become anymore.i used to love this show so much at one point. it has a dense universe. george r. r. martin is amazing at world building. the first four seasons did well to capture a side of westeros and essos but it just starts to lack after. fortunately there are more shows coming within the world of game of thrones so we can only hope these pick up the same golden status it use to have and help us explore this deep dark beautiful world.

title: Should have been a 10!
review: this show was great! a must watch. i (like most of the world) was disappointed and downright mad at the rushed last season. why would the writers do that? we may never know.i'd probably be rewatching the whole series if it ended they it should have. but all of that aside, it really was my favorite show ever.the story, the actors, sets, costumes, etc were all far better than any other tv series.it should have been a 10 but the last 3 episodes knocked it to a 9.9 is still worth a watch. and if you know that the last season is disappointing you might not be as heartbroken as the world was after waiting a year and a half!

title: late stage feminist propaganda imho
review: i've only just seen the first episode , my children love it and i can't speak frankly to them but i have to speak somewhere or explode. all the males are either brutal/evil or weak, or both. except the little person - since he's half the size of the girls and rather aberrant, he's allowed some leeway. all the females are abused. poor things. except that little maisie character. they could have entitled it "this is why we need feminism" with a sideline of "blm", as the black women have it worse although they seem willing enough. it's not boring, thanks to alternating sex and violence. the sex is never prurient, unless you have a rear-entry fetish. the loudly praised "production values" - lousy - the special effects very unconvincing - maybe i shouldn't be thinking of braveheart - it's just so nasty - makes me depressed that it's so popular. "fantasy" is necessary because there's no need to attend to actual human feeling or behavior, it's "make believe". it sure as hell is. i'm not against fantasy, if it has some real psychological truth under it, like jack and the beanstalk. this is one lie after another. i hate it i hate it i hate it. i think the snow white blond gets her revenge on everybody later in the series but i don't care. it's so bad. i don't mind nudity, or even weak men - i loved the unbearable lightness of being. i just hate it when something awful is so popular and praised everywhere. sigh.

title: Anticpating "The Dragon & the Wolf"
review: so now the dragon queen has saved jon snow's poorly manned & equipped mission by airlifting the survivors and their wight prisoner back to safety, we'll have to see how those poor buggers of the night's watch defend their silly wooden "fort zinderneuf" of a defensive position against the night king now that he has 're,animated' the dragon he killed. questions to ask are: will the dragon be loyal to 'ol blue eyes' or flee back to the lovin' arms of his mommy? if the dragon decides to hang with the night king, will it be using a modified weapons system, i.e. will a 'blue dragon' breath ice instead of fire? either way, the members of the watch are gonna get their arses eaten if they stay on that ridiculously equipped wall. meanwhile, the united kingdoms are gonna have to get busy slaughtering anything that ain't human that has a fur coat to fit out all those slow-moving troops, who are going to devastate the entire countryside as they eat everything in sight on their locust-like trip to engage the bad guys up north. i don't think cersi is gonna live by a ration book, do you? can't wait to see the night walkers check out some books from the citadel without their library cards, eh?

title: The Ending Worked for Me
review: got was an epic that had its own rules defined by the author. it took many of us on an incredible journey over years.the ending worked for me precisely because it was generally unsatisfying in a number of ways but very much in line with its own universe in which happy fairy,tale endings arise in the fantasies of children but dissolve under the weight of harsh realities.a happy ending in this complex and brutal world of political intrigue, betrayal, expediency and survival of the most unscrupulous would have been the most disappointing ending."happy ever after" never had a reasonable chance in this universe.

title: The best i've seen!
review: this series has a story that unravels piece by piece, and gives time for the characters to develop and show their acting! the actors excel in every scene and the story keeps you glued to the tv. it is really the best series i have ever seen, it has action and the storyline is great. it's difficult to describe how good it is, the scenarios are deep and bring us to forget day to day life. it is way better than a lord of the rings version series, it's story is richer and more compelling, has less action, but it's story compensates. i compare it with battlestar galactica or stargate atlantis, that were well written and produced, but i think this one could be better. pros: actors, storyline , well produced, action! i think the producers prove themselves as genius not in movies but only in series, as it is a lot more difficult to keep a great audience for a long time, and this one could be one of those!!

title: One of a kind success that ended in Hindenburg-like disaster
review: as other users have mentioned, the first few seasons (1,6) of the show were a phenomenon. a story that had us gossip, speculate, theorize, and enjoy for years.but somewhere after season 6, the show ran out of book material and into uncharted waters. blinded by their past success, i assume the show runners felt they were up to the task of taking it to a proper end.in season 7 you could notice signs of the downfall, like they were trying to foreshadow it.and then season 8 happened. after a 2 year break the anticipation was as high as it can be. after each failed episode, illogical character arc, rich story line butchered or forgotten, i'd tell myself that maybe the next episode will redeem the show. but it never came.i will remember this show not for what it was, but for what it could have been. i'm giving it 7 stars. one for each episode that i liked. my only consolation now is that grrm will finish the books, so that i can how the story should have ended.

title: Ruined
review: in these difficult, lonely times, curious first,timers might want to take the plunge on a binge watch of this vast story. as a former fan who loved thrones for many years, i think i can be a reliable guide to help you away from this dangerous temptation.although i'm not a fan of fantasy as a genre, i was drawn to the complex plot and the constellation of frequently gripping characters. at its best, every scene had purpose; and, taken as a whole, the show had the fascination of a snake pit. unfortunately, right from the first scene of the first episode onwards, the whole narrative is directed torwards its end point. while this gives drive to the plot and makes for compelling viewing at the time, it means ultimately the whole thing sinks or swims depending on what the ending becomesthe ending of this particular tv drama is without a doubt the worst i have ever personally watched. it betrays itself in just about every way, to force an ending that is about the worst possible type to be. everything that made it great for fantasy and non-fantasy fans alike, is ditched for a lazy, arrogant parody of itself. during the last episode, despite knowing what was coming, i had my head in my hands and was wincing at nearly every line of dialogue. the whole thing feels like it was written over a drunken/ coked-up weekend, and they later hadn't bothered to reread anything they'd put down. frequently, the dialogue and events don't make sense from minute-to-minute, sometimes even second-to-second.if someone had told me at the beginning of last year that after watching season 8 i would never want to watch any episodes of thrones ever again (and wish i had never even started), i wouldn't have believed them. even if it was disappointing, surely there must be something to salvage, with so many characters, so many storylines? think again. characters i used to love had become incoherent, empty husks of themselves; usually grossly underwritten, and frequently dislikable. the substantive plot had degraded so much, to something only goldfish with 10-second memories could enjoy. even now i still can't quite believe what happened. the twists i was expecting, the meaning behind events, and characters' behaviour: all just evaporates into a smug nihilistic void. thrones for me is now just a bad memory.the ending is now one of the lowest rated endings of any long-running tv show on imdb. on the first anniversary of this tv massacre, the millions of us who were narratively victimised should hold fast to our responsibility to continue to dissuade innocents from joining our ranks.save yourself many hours of your life: do not watch game of thrones.

title: Excellent adaptation of an amazing book, with some notable flaws
review: ever since the first book was released in 1996, i have been an ardent fan of the song of ice and fire books by george r. r. martin; the series is one of the best fantasy novel series ever written in my opinion. as such, i have eagerly anticipated the tv adaptation of the books. now that season one has finished, i feel i am able to give a complete and fair review of this show.season one of game of thrones does an excellent job of staying true to the first book of martin's series named, not surprisingly, game of thrones. the plot of this book revolves around three major story lines: the political tensions on the continent of westeros that eventually lead to a conflict known as the war of the five kings, the exiled princess daenerys targaryen who plots to reclaim the rule of westeros that her family has ruled for nearly the last 300 years until robert's rebellion (yes, the same king robert baratheon in the show), and the awakening of an ancient evil known as the others in the north beyond the wall. the show aptly captures the essence of each of these three story lines, tying them together cleverly so that the audience sees how each of these three threads are being woven into one overarching plot. given that even 10 hours worth of material is not nearly enough to tell the full story in the book version of game of thrones, the writers of the show should be applauded for brilliantly transferring to the small screen all of the foreshadowing, character motivations and personalities, cultures, drama, politics, and emotion of the book.the acting is top notch. nearly every actor brilliantly portrays their characters just as they are portrayed in the books. it is worth watching these episodes over and over again just to see their performances. even the children actors do a fantastic job. the sets and costume designs are also very well done , i wonder if there was any collaboration with those who worked on the tudors, a somewhat similar series on hbo that reminds me of this show in terms of set and costume designs. now on to the parts of the show that i felt like were disappointing. even though hbo apparently sunk nearly five million dollars into each episode, the show still felt low budget. perhaps the most disappointing part of the show was the fact that most of the action scenes from the book were either emitted or harshly truncated in the show. the choreography of the few action scenes that were in the show were mediocre, i felt. given that the story largely revolves around a war, it is a bit silly to not even attempt to show any of the battles in this war. budget constraints are no excuse - the history channel does a fine job of portraying epic historical battles using almost no budget at all.some other rather disappointing facets of the show that reeked of low budget was the fact that nearly every scene was a scaled down version of the scene from the book (save for the end of episode 9 - now that was brilliantly executed). for example, khal drogo's khalasar is a horde that consists of about forty thousand warriors alone, and yet no more than about 10-15 are shown at any one time. the result is that the viewer never really realizes how powerful khal drogo is and why daenarys is such an important character. hbo could have used a little bit of creative cgi to easily show the true scope of many scenes from the book. the direwolves were also conspicuously absent throughout the show. in the book, they played a much larger role. i will say that i was pleasantly surprised with the cgi in the final scene of the final episode, however. now why couldn't such cgi have been used for the direwolves? budget constraints, i know, but come on, hbo had five million dollars to work with per episode - that's not exactly a shoestring budget (though admittedly, not such a large budget either - consider many one and half hour movies have cost over 100 million dollars to make).another complaint i have with the show was some of the unnecessary sex sequences. given the gritty realness of the books, it was certainly necessary to show sex and violence in the show to adequately capture the mood of the books. however, hbo went way overboard here. given that it's important to squeeze as much plot as possible into every episode, unnecessary and extraneous sexual sequences serve absolutely no purpose other than to mollify desperate and horny teenage boys, and in fact cheapen the importance of the main story lines. i had the same complaint with hbo's the tudors as well. so overall, this show did an excellent job, with some glaring exceptions. to sum up...pros: excellent acting, excellent portrayal of the plot, mood, and characters from the book, excellent sets and costume designcons: flagrant lack of action sequences, including failing to show battles in a story that revolves around a war, scaled down scope of many scenes, the direwolves didn't get the screen time they deserved, and unnecessary sex scenes.

title: Best Show of All Time (not exaggerating)
review: when you seriously consider the best shows of all time this is up in the conversation even with the most controversial final season of tv show history. most will say that ruined the show or it's not how you start, it's how you finish. crap. breaking bad is not better than this show, if game of thrones somehow ended at season 5 the content would brake it a 10 star show for everyone and 3xbetter than any nearby show, but it's not a 5 season show it's an at least 10 season show and that's where it went wrong but that not enough to knock it. you cannot compare a show like breaking bad to game of thrones and even though breaking bad is great it was saved by a good ending everything else was dominated by game of thrones, any other show can be compared but look at any part of game of thrones and compare it with that show for the first 7 seasons and notice the gap in quality then take the last season and compare them, does the quality make up for it, i doubt it. please don't be deterred from watching this show it is a masterpiece and deserves more respect and i hope the prequel series can bring the name up to a cornerstone of pop culture once again where it deserves to be. i never fail to love a moment in another show or film where there's a game of thrones reference i'm addicted like that, i tear up watching trailers for the series, i love this show, and i know anyone who has watched it loves this show.

title: Best series i've ever seen, i've even forgiven the end
review:
wow! by far the best series i have ever seen in my life. i am basically a fan of movies and series based on books, although they often differ greatly from the actual content. this is not the case with this series at all.
until season 7, the series follows geroge r. r. martin almost in perfection, but you don't get the impression that the actors read something from a piece of paper. every actor shows performances and lets you feel emotions, i have never seen in a movie or series before.
because of the higher number of main characters it is incredibly exciting until the very last episode. there is not just one character that you are excited about and that you love, there are thirteen (main characters).
there is no clear separation between black and white, between good and evil, there is no hero without flaw. you think and feel with each of these characters, and george r. r. martin always manages to change your mind about a character on which you have already formed an opinion. a good example is theon greyjoy:
i went from not caring about theon,
to hating theon,
to being disgusted by theon,
to feeling sad for theon,
to rooting for theon,
to being proud of theon,
to wanting to follow theon into battle.
that is how to write a character. utter brillance, george r. r. martin!
nevertheless, for me the most important thing in a film and especially in a series is the story. again, i must say that i have never seen such a precise, well,written, exciting, gripping, detailed, thoughtful, dynamic and emotional story. for those who don't know, the story is set in a fictional world and takes place on the continents of westeros and essos. the seven kingdoms of westeros resemble the european middle ages and are shielded by a huge wall of ice from an area of eternal winter in the north. spring, summer, autumn and winter can last for several years or even decades, their length is variable and unpredictable. the story begins at the end of a long summer and is initially told in three storylines, largely parallel to each other. tensions build up between the powerful noble houses of the empire, which eventually lead to an open fight for the throne. winter is coming, and a danger from a foreign power is looming in the far north of westeros, where the night watch at the wall is supposed to protect the kingdoms. in essos, daenerys targaryen, heiress of the royal family of westeros, which was deposed years ago, is striving to regain power.
the insanely complex story deals primarily with politics and power struggles, social relations, wars and religions.
the book is written in a demanding but not incomprehensible way, what is a very great art.
since david benioff and d. b. weiss follow the book for the most part, the series has the great effect that you put on headphones, the light dims, and you are no longer at home, you are at winterfell or king's landing.
no other series has made me feel this as much as game of thrones. compared to other fantasy stories, like the lord of rings, the witcher, or the chronicles of narnia, game of thrones is packed with breathtaking special effects, incredibly emotional and multi-faceted dialogues, gorgeous costumes, and funny sayings.
a wonderful addition from hbo is the music in the series. it is better than anything before. even movies like interstellar, star wars, pirates of the caribbean or gladiator can still learn something from game of thrones' music.
the only deficit in the series is season 8, which destroyed my desire to rewatch game of thrones.

title: Greatest show ever produced on planet Earth till now
review: just finished watching game of thrones all 8 seasons,i know many people didn't like the show because of the season 8 but for me at least from my perspective season 8 is the best,i know may people didn't like the season finale for the tragic death of daenerys in the hand of the man she loved,but actually,i appreciated this murder,the way daenerys slaughtered thousands of innocent people in kings landing,she didn't deserve to live. many people can argue that daenerys' friend missandei was murdered,one of her child dragon was murdered so she destroyed the king's landing to avenge their death but the truth is in this series many families were slaughtered by lannisters from oberyn martell to ned stark but none of their family members slaughtered innocent people because of that.actually i think daenerys did this, because she wanted to show world,her power what she was really capable of,but at the end of the day we should always remember "karma is a bi*ch" and also "pride is the root of the fall"only thing that bothered me in season 8 was the killing of night king in the hand of arya stark i didn't understand where she came from🙄 or even how she came🙄to godswoodthe ending was great,as we all know books haven't been published yet,so we can't know the real ending,without the book what the showrunners have managed to make,hats off to them and to their genius mindkeeping all the arguments beside my final verdict on the show is this is a masterpiece and till now according to me it's the greatest show ever produced on planet earth

title: What have you done, GoT?
review: i hated the game of thrones final seasons... that's what people have been saying since the show ended in 2019. to be honest, i don't have problems with all the events that took place in seasons 7 and 8, but i strongly dislike how some things were developed. in that case, i will talk about daenerys becoming the "mad queen". however, truth be told, some characters' fate just didn't make sense at all and in that case, i will talk about jaime lannister.as previously stated, maybe disagreeing with a considerable part of the fans (or ex,fans), i don't think the idea of daenerys "burning them all" is disposable, but it should be better constructed. the concept behind madness being on her blood after all is certainly compelling. in fact, if you are a fan of the show, you can't deny "this is so game of thrones". daenerys had already prioritized her own beliefs above others' point of view, like when she decided to forcibly free slaves, although some of them were happier with their owners. however, none of those previous actions stablished that she was becoming what she has always fought against: someone who kills innocents. even when she killed randyll and dickon tarly, she offered them the option to bend the knee (since they could've been manipulated by cersei). thus, what i mean is that if there were more scenes in which she acted more villainously (e.g. leaving innocents to die because the throne was more important), maybe burning thousands of surrendered civilians and soldiers alive would be a little coherent with her character development.regarding jaime lannister, his ending was even more incoherent. having one of the best stories of the show, in my opinion, we could see a terrible selfish man turning into someone who shows his fragilities and acknowledges his mistakes. the arc in which he loses his right hand (symbol of everything he thought he was), confesses the truth about how he became the "kingslayer" and starts to realize that some things in life aren't black and white is simply amazing. in the great war, he even helps the north against the army of the dead - right after the touching scene in which he knigths brienne, even though a woman couldn't be knighted. in other words, this character gradually won our hearts with a mature story to die, at the end, in the arms of a toxic person that never did anything truly good to him. congrats, hbo. if you wanted to surprise us, well done.all in all, believe me when i say i'm not a hater. different from many people i've heard out there, i don't agree the final seasons ruined the whole show. of course, we have a couple of problems that i bet the got readers are expecting r. r. martin to fix, but those issues can't completely burn all the epic battles, deaths and stories to ashes (like daenerys with king's landing).

title: An intriguing story which got diluted in the final episodes
review: after hearing rave reviews about got, i watched all the episodes without taking a long break (like 3,4days break) in between so as to actually understand the world of got. the way the initial seasons was directed and paced was very interesting and hook the audience for more of it. until season 5, i could see the way the characters and their purpose was defined even for a background artist. it was a visual grandeur and the dialogues were too good for us to decipher the actual meaning.but i felt the makers started to hurry up from season 6 without giving a proper closure for many characters not having a logical reason for any particular sub story making the viewers feel the distraction. final season had some high points as well as its lows with many sub plots unattended or left for the user's discretion. plots especially like what exactly arya do with her face changing skill except to avenge her brother's death or what will be essos after daenerys death? also jon snow's inability to take a wise decision at crucial times all made the story and the series weak.in my opinion, they could have taken the detailed approach as done in first few seasons so as to have a proper closure and a satisfying ending. over all if you are nor too much into details and logics and enjoy the screen work in terms of acting, costumes, graphics then a must watch series.

title: Oh my God what a piece of crap!
review: ok, so i gave this show chance given its rave reviews and very high rating on imdb. i have to say i love the graphic style and cinematography, watching it all on blu,ray disc on a 106" projected screen in a dedicated home cinema. it is a feast for the eye and ear!but content?? after mere minutes - before the title sequence of the first episode - i am lost in glowing blue eyes and supernatural crap.i am sure this show must get its high rating from the amount of exposed lady skin and focus on sex from role-playing acne-be-fest teenage clowns that would normally run around in the (same as in the show?) woods dressed like kings, queens and darth vaders, and whose only claim to skin must be that they were close to the set when this aired.it holds absolutely no value to me. i am not interested in seeing sisters and brothers going at it with each other. or midget sex. if you are an adventure loving clown, be my guest. if you value half a bit of decency combined with just a tiny part realism, stay away.the only cool piece was when they actually included prince charming from skrek in the form of jamie lannister, played by nikolaj coaster-waldau. fit man for the comic role.piece of crap.

title: Awesome until final season
review: i have heard many things about this show, such as how fantastic the music is or how amazing the actors are. but through all of the great things i have heard, there always was the same but... "the ending is terrible." i hoped that maybe they just had a different taste in shows than i did and the ending wouldn't be too awful, but man was i wrong! how did the writers manage to ruin such an amazing show, quite possibly the best show of all time, and certainly my favorite show up until season 8. i am so disappointed and heartbroken it's unbelievable. i wish there was some way for the final season to be remade. if this occurs in my life i could die a happy man. although the ending is terrible, i would still recommend the show to anyone, as it is brilliant, suspenseful, action packed, and the dialogue and acting is outstanding.

title: OVERVIWE OF GOT
review: in a general assessment game of throne is said to be one of the most fascinating tv series of all time, simply because of the type of drama it brings along, and also it plot, cast and character, theme, inspiration and derivation. it stories timeline tends to send a clear message of how inspiring and educative this movie is, and more especially the personal life lessons it teaches it audience. but what is more captivating and more thriving and seems to be the journey of the movie is what surrounded on it major theme politics. the fight of the iron throne. it gives audience a gloomy aftermath of how devious politics is, if it played in the wrong way. it typically portrays in the movie how it brings a decline to the seven kingdoms especially the capital kingslanding. the ambition of power without knowing it true essence, it purposes, it objectives tends to bring anarchy and catastrophe, which eventually lead as a direct effect to it subject. a lesson that will be learn by all, even the former us president barack obama comment on that. and as for the me, the most touching theme is the bridge between the rich and the power, the series tends to portray a narrative that tells how this equation is truly unbalance, the will that has been written between the rich and the poor. since the beginning of time this has been a major problem in societies and it remedy is truly tedious to find, so the movie tells us how this thing will be constantly going back and forth. the personal life lessons been portraying in the series is what makes it the best movie of all time, and also the aspect of love, it tends to tell us that love is the strongest affection in life, it comes natural and it eventually lead to possibly everything. so in conclusion the series has attracted a lot of viewers all over the world and it has a huge praise on it acting, which eventually shows how influential this movie was, it fictional contents brings a sense of reality in audience for a greater purpose in life and a call to humanity since the starting of dawn that let love lead.

title: Game of Thrones, the best fantasy série ever ...
review:
game of thrones is a us fantasy drama series, directed by mark huffam. it was originally released on the hbo on 11 april 2011. as of now, 8 seasons and 73 episodes of the series are available.the cast :peter dinklage as tyrion lannisterkit harington as jon snowemilia clarke as daenerys targaryensean bean an ned starksophie turner as sansa starkmaisie williams as arya starkisaac hempstead,wright as bran starkthe story : the story is set in the kingdom of the seven crowns.
it is the story of seven families of lords who after the death of their king fight for the thrones and the crowns to become the future king of the seven crowns, they will go to war but an army of the living dead is the march to destroy the world.my opinion:
i find the séries very well scripred with a suspence that lasts in time, and the twists are unexpected. it's a simply awesome series !

title: Best Show Ever!
review: this show is amazing! do not believe any of the negative comments of these reviews.i haven't been able to watch any other show and truly enjoy it. i've tried watching multiple of other shows but don't even come close to game of thrones.to start off with the story line is absolutely brilliant with an entirely different world. the series starts with a fantastic intro which gives an idea of westeros for those who haven't read the books.apart from that, the character development, acting, costumes, cgi and cinematography are also superb which is what gives this show so much life.can not forget to mention the music; hats off to ramin djawadi he's a real talent. the scenes makes them more filled with emotion or tension.expect the unexpected, with many plot twists, it will definitely be worth your time!

title: Binge the show for a more satisfying ending
review: i made this account for this review. when you binge this show you can overlook many of the mistakes of the final season. watching the show over an extended period you forget a lot of character details which are necessary for the ending to make the most sense.** spoilers below ** when you binge the show you can connect dots you otherwise forget which makes the mediocre final season terrible. when you re,watch the show you notice things, live the first time arya sees a person die, she grins and you know her story has make sense the whine time. but she's not the disappointment. keys talk daenerys, the final season seemingly makes her turn from somewhat reasonable to insane in an instant, but if you pay attention she's been nuts the whole time. she's just fought it well. but there's moments from the vet beginning you see her rage, her want to watch things burn.if the end ruined this show for you, do yourself a favor and watch it again will everything you know now. pay attention to the character's. sure they rushed the end, sure there's some plot holes for the sake of tv and time, but this show as a whole is one of the greatest things to ever come from cinema. in my opinion it's meant to be an 80 hour movie, not a series of episodes watched over a period of months or years.

title: Considering the whole series this is best I have watched ever
review: game of thrones this is the most wonderful series i have ever seen in my life. i felt like first few episodes where some much lagging. but after that the series started to take my heart. and it started building much hope in me. it continued for at least episode 5 of the season 8 hardly but after seeing the last episode of the series i felt much upset. it broke all the built up it had made since there. i felt like an abrupt ending. it left more confusion and was hard to end. i feel like they could have made it better.1 star goes in rating because of last episode and a few if first.

title: The best fantasy series of all time if not the best show of all time
review: in my opinion game of thrones is one of the best if not the best show ever made. the writers made what i and a lot of other people would consider several mistakes especially with the 8th season (there are 8 in total). but to sum it all up, just know that if you are really into maybe the lord of the rings/the hobbit or maybe a little bit of the harry potter kind of area, it takes a little of those fantasy aspects to the extreme, and throws them into a very harsh and oddly addicting universe, and although i'll admit the show has several flaws over the seasons sometimes due to this very extreme and intense nature, i want you to hear me when i seriously tell you that all of the good parts make the bad parts worth it, especially if you make it to season 6 (the last two episodes of that season are the best in the show if not in any show), is got for everyone? doubt it, no show seems to be, but it's good enough that it really is worth a try, i wouldn't watch it if blood makes you sick, if violence disturbs you. it has good moments, but a lot of it isn't for the faint of heart. with all of that said game of thrones really is a must,watch.

title: One downside...
review: it's a shame they never finished off the series and made a season 8... in reality though, after season 7 it went so terribly i can't group them together in my mind.if it is your first time watching the series it is fantastic! but i recommend not watching the eighth season, it had different writers and just went terribly and makes no sense compared to the the rest of the series. this is just a recommendation to spare this terrible fanfiction (season 8) from ruining the rest of the show for you.

title: GOT the GOAT
review: game of thrones is considered to be the best tv series of all time. while many people compare game of thrones to shows like breaking bad and the sopranos i think they are completely different sides of tv, that are impossible to compare. i think game of thrones season 1,4 is the best thing i have ever seen. while season 5 and 6 might have slightly worse writing are both still amazing season 6 has so many great scenes.i am saddened by season 7 as much as it was entertaining and better than most tv shows. i have seen someone say game of thrones used to be chess and now it's tic tac toe and i completely agree. when you compare it to season 1-6 it's very disappointing and feels more like marvel avengers than the dark, mysterious and all the backstabbing we all love. game of thrones was so good as it broke from the hollywood norm not even the main characters are safe. the show came much more predictable and characters started to feel invincible meaning the show starts to lack tension and get more boring.season 8 let's just forgot this exists.overall it's my personal favourite tv series even though i do think shows like the sopranos and breaking bad are better written game of thrones just has a certain feeling that no other show has ever made me feel. i'm always nervous, sometimes laughing, sometimes horrified and sometimes i will be left with my jaw open standing in-front of my tv jumping up and down with excitement. the whole ride is like a adrenaline shot. if your thinking of watching this all i'm going to say that it's rated 9.2 on imdb for a reason.

title: Wish it never existed now after the mess it made
review: i wish there was a way to magically to take back all the hours spent watching this show, rewatching, theorizing, speculating, watching lore videos, theory videos and even reading the books , after the way this season happened. this season eviscerated not only just the show itself but all the fans' hopes and expectations. all that effort from the cast and crew was for what? all that passion from fans worldwide was for what? the writers blundered through this season and i wonder how toxic the culture must have been for them to get error after basic error abandoning stories, characters and physics that were established in previous seasons (sometimes abandoned between episodes). were the writers not listening to criticism, feedback or ideas from the cast and the crew? i hope some time in the future there is an investigation into how such a colossal mess up was allowed to air and what horrors happened behind the scenes. until then, i will try to forget this show ever existed, unsuccessfully.

title: What an Ending?
review: i didn't start this show because i wanted to watch it, i started this show because i could not stop hearing game of thrones references in all the conversations i'd have, so i ended up thinking well if everyone is having a good time watching it i'd try it out. boy was i in for a great time binging this show, it is amazing in every way, it had a good storyline throughout the entire show, ( well most of it but that's for the end of the review) and it didn't always give you what you want which is a good thing. in different shows you can always tell what's about to happen, who's going to die, who's going to get the girl but in this one not at all, your always on your toes. i would definitely recommend this to anyone leaning weather to watch or not your in for a treat. overall i give this a 9/10 only because of its ending i'd say it was the worst ending imaginable for anyone who has invested so much time into the show but is still worth a watch.

title: Review about the series "Game of Thrones"
review: hello everybody! i want to tell you about the series "game of thrones". i think if you start watching it, then you will not resist and look at all the seasons that came out. the series is based on the series of novels "a song of ice and fire" by george martin.seven kingdoms have long been fighting for the iron throne, for the right to rule over all kingdoms. and each applicant believes that he is special and worthy of this honor. and then, from the north, a threat comes in the form of a revived army of the dead, white walkers, to put it simply, in which no one immediately believes. war of the living with the undead.characters. they are very bright and charismatic characters, and all of them are both negative and positive. my favourite is the winterfell stark family.and the best in my opinion were john snow bastard from house of stark, jaime and the dwarf tyrion lannister. each role is played one hundred percent and each emotion is shown to the viewer in maximum detail.i recommend it for viewing, the series is addictive, there is something to see in it. you will either like the series and drag you to watch all seasons, or cause disgust or some other emotions, but you will definitely not remain indifferent!

title: Lord Snow the best guys
review: game of thrones is an american fantasy drama television series created by david benioff and d. b. weiss for hbo. it is an adaptation of a song of ice and fire, a series of fantasy novels by george r. r. martin, the first of which is a game of thrones. the show was shot in the united kingdom, canada, croatia, iceland, malta, morocco, and spain. it premiered on hbo in the united states on april 17, 2011, and concluded on may 19, 2019, with 73 episodes broadcast over eight seasons. set on the fictional continents of westeros and essos, game of thrones has a large ensemble cast and follows several story arcs throughout the course of the show. the first major arc concerns the iron throne of the seven kingdoms of westeros through a web of political conflicts among the noble families either vying to claim the throne or fighting for independence from whoever sits on it. a second focuses on the last descendant of the realm's deposed ruling dynasty, who has been exiled to essos and is plotting a return and reclaim the throne. the third follows the night's watch, a military order defending the realm against threats from beyond westeros's northern border. 20/20 guys go watch this uwu.

title: I have trust issues with TV shows now...
review: game of thrones was my entire life for the better part of 3 years. i talked about it so frequently and it was easily in my honest opinion the best thing on television by far. seasons 1,6 are some of the most clever and best things i've seen pretty much ever. i mean great acting, well written dialouge, amazing characters, and so on and so forth. i can't believe even in 2021 that i'm sitting here and i'm saying that the ending is insulting. it's not the "worst" ending even to a tv show standpoint by definition. i mean it still looks fantastic, the acting is still pretty damn good, and the music of season 8 is absolutely perfect. the issue lies in the characters being a shell of what they were in prior seasons and the awful writing.in conclusion. i've started to watch a lot of great tv shows recently like mad men, breaking bad, the handmaids tale, etc and few things have come even close to my love for the first 4 seasons of game of thrones and i still think game of thrones is my personal favorite show but.. the ending is left as the most disappointing thing ever created in terms of media i've ever seen. that being said season's 1-4 are amazing! 10/10. season 5 is rocky but still game of thrones. season 6 is slow but the last two episodes are so good that it might be the closest thing to perfectionin my eyes. season 7 is honestly rough but still pretty good. season 8 is so insulting that it plagues my nightmares. 8/10 and honestly still worth your time to watch the early seasons. just make up your own ending :p.

title: Season 1 being pure briliance, gradual decline thereafter (from very mild to EPIC)
review: the myth of got being a perfect show exept for a terribly rushed last season is just that: a myth. many have already debunked it, yet it's still a popular and simple version i see around here. i for one saw a brilliant first season,-added scenes were building on complex characters (like robert's and cersei's exchange and toast to their dreadful marriage), a witty, enjoyable second one with some minor strays (changing robb's love interest actually poses problems for the narrative), a great third season (hello, red wedding! hello jaime's confession in the bathtub!) with some poor choices ("mhysa" ends really clumsy and way uncomfortable with its "white savior" imagery), then a quite an unbalanced fourth season, especially after the epic purple wedding (tysha practically being left out starts the absolute decline of tyrion's character arc). season 5 manages to run out of steam pretty fast with its horrendous dorne plot and snail-like tyrion arc (this is when he's starting being severely dumbed down), and whatdayyaknow! that's just when the source material starts running out on d&d's as well. what a coincidence (not really).season 6 is already a different show, with occasional great moments (cersei's final act to secure power), but more in terms of filmmaking than writing or character building (her blowing up the sept has no consequence , which is insane for a show that used to be deeply rooted in realpolitik). everything is bigger in budget and production value, but it's hardly better. got just grew more and more popular regardless, because apparently people gathered in bars to watch it (seriously?) and needed explosions to cheer at.season 7, oh well... it pretty much set the stage for the laughable dumpsterfire that was season 8 ("beyond the wall" only being the most glaring example of tragic writing). another epic drop in quality? sure. but hardly the only thing the show failed at. almost nothing worked and was confusing and uninspired (ed sheeran wasn't helping either, but i guess it ain't his fault). just showed how much the show got swallowed up by its own popularity and desire to hype itself up even more.it's a great show or its first 3,5 seasons or so, at least for me. fantastic actors, of course, and a beautiful job done by so many people--except the showrunners who clearly had other priorities and lack of skill to pull this (admittedly massive beast) off.

title: Please remake last season.
review: game of thrones is in my opinion best serie ever made ( until the last season at least ). characters are so well done, i'm amazed by the quantity of characters they made without making a mess ,developing them all almost perfectly. each story could be an independent story but they all were written to perfectly exist in synchrony. there a lapse of time between ss 4 and 6 where everything is perfect, it was a constant feeling of satisfaction that i never felt before in a serie. it's a shame that the last season feels disappointing, it's not the worst ending but an amazing serie deserves a better end for those characters that we loved for such long a time.

title: Would have been 11/10 if there wasnt Season 8
review: i personally hate that the show gets so much hate for its last season. i get that a lot of people have their problems with it and so do i, but that just doesnt take away how great the other seasons are. i actually would consider this show to be the best thing i have ever watched on tv.brilliant story, the best dialogue scenes i have ever seen, brilliant acting, great choreographies and special effects, but what i love most about this series is that it plays with your feelings so much. this is the first time ive seen a story where noone is safe. sometimes after certain episodes you sit there for an hour, thinking, before you can get back into reallife.this is a love letter to the best show i have ever watched and will be the last and only review i will ever write.10/10.

title: Lots of time spent going no where
review: read the book.....avoid it. it doesn't have an ending.watched the show.some good characters and i enjoyed how there were multiple story,lines going on at the same time.but, the whole knights and ladies and stuff kind of starts to wear thin around season 5.in the end i feel like the its much ado about nothing. kind of disappointed by it. no heroic ending or triumphant conclusion. for me, it just falls short of being memorable and that is a let down having spent some time invested in seeing it through to the finish.some good moments but i only ever got excited or wanted to continue watching a handful of times. for an 8 season show that's not enough.hate to say but if you are going to commit 80 hrs of your life to something, don't make it this. it's more tragedy than comedy and there is no real takeaway. swipe left.

title: Worth the wait.
review: one of the best things about certain books is that, for me, they lead to pleasant, but not vapid escapism, and the song of ice and fire always fitted that bill for me. as a historian, the grittiness bypasses all those silly notions of a romantic, bucolic mediaeval period.television adaptations, such as this one, must take certain liberties, but here they have been, for the most part, subtle enough to not be jarring or irritating. the only one of note so far that concerned me was the "outing" of renly and loras tyrell so blatantly. the subtlety of the book was much better and allowed a better introduction for characters who are important later on, namely brienne and margery tyrell. that said, i wont worry too much about it.the characters are well drawn, with decent personalities that reflect the shades of grey in real life. even the most venal characters have some redeeming features which are not brought in apologetically. their character is allowed to stand without such self,conscious presentation. obviously certain parts of the books could not be easily filmed, or legally filmed, but the main atmosphere is still there.to my mind it is preferable to lord of the rings, to which all fantasy seems to be compared. i enjoyed lotr, book more than films, i just prefer this to either though i do wish the books would come faster! for myself, i would recommend exploring this excellent series. have some care as to the depicted violence, both against humans and animals. it certainly did not bother me, but i know some people might be disturbed by some of the imagery.

title: From book to Screen - Flawless
review: *** this review may contain spoilers ***this can be a great series, it truly can. and i hope it will be. it is imported for me to state,just like everyone else does that it stays very true to the books. this is both a blessing and a curse. as anyone can see almost all reviews here are done by fans of the books. i myself have read the books, but i am no fan. as for me, i hope the series will not completely copy the books total lack of plot. the white walkers – seen in the start of the pilot – will they have a role to play? or will they like in the books first be heard from again in 200 episodes time. if the series stays true to the books we will get just what they where – "days of our lives" set in the middle ages. containing lots of hate, betrayal, penthouse forum letters, betrayal, intrigue, betrayal and betrayal. with any shadow of a plot finely gets brutally murdered and has a wolfs head sown on its shoulders instead of its own head did i mention betrayal?but the series starts well enough, awesome location shots and lots of great actors. that some of the characters are a little flat is not the fault of the actors. it is to early to tell if the style holds out or if they decide to put in a plot. it would create an uproar from the fans of the books – but it would also make for a much better show. as one reviewer puts it, "the series revolves around eddard stark and his family. he has a wife and five children, three sons and two daughters. eddard stark is ruler of the north and close friend of king robert who needs his help in ruling the seven kingdoms."*** major spoiler don't read on *** hard to say how they would handel the early death of both characters. time will tell

title: A Tapestry Of Music And Story
review: the iconic motto of house stark, "winter is coming," as first said by the beloved fan,favorite character eddard "ned" stark, easily captures the viewers' attention. they serve as a warning and foreshadow the darkness and evil that lurk in upcoming episodes. three simple words that unwittingly take a seemingly typical epic fantasy series; and transform it into something unique. "a song of ice and fire," also commonly known as simply "game of thrones," is a fantastical political drama with a dash of "chosen one" elements and iconic characters beloved and cherished by fans around the globe. the game of thrones series is one of the best and most popular epic fantasy series ran on international television and might be one of the best fantasy stories of all time.game of thrones is based on the "a song of ice and fire" book series, written by george r. r. martin starting with "a game of thrones" beginning in 1991 and was published in 1996, most recently, "a dance with dragons" in 2011 with "the winds of winter" currently in the works and "a dream of spring" being planned to be written in the future. george r. r. martin, david benioff, and d. b. weiss, co-creators of the game of thrones tv series, have gone on record stating the inspirations for the books and the tv series were the wars of the roses from 22 may 1455 - 16 june 1487 and "the accursed kings," a novel by french author maurice druon.the series takes on a segmented approach and style when telling the main characters' stories as their adventures progress over the continents of westeros and essos, changing from one to the next, which could be confusing to newcomers to the series. one moment you could be overseeing the point of view of tyrion lannister as he navigates the perils of the kings' court in kings landing, another moment you could be witnessing a battle fought beyond the wall by jon snow, then finally cheering on daenerys targaryen as she leads her army to bring down a patriarchal society that runs on the enslavement of women and children. all the stories are told in a way that may seem confusing and at times may even be perceived as not having much of a purpose, but seemingly innocent or non-important actions and conversations of one character may have severe consequences and ramifications later on in the same episode or even several seasons on for another character; demanding the viewer pay close attention to every detail and conversation on screen.one reason game of thrones is a fantastic tv series is the characters themselves; after all, there would be no series or show without the characters. most of the main characters hail from one of four noble houses; the baratheons with a banner of a crowned black stag on a golden field, the starks with a grey direwolf on a white field, the lannisters with a golden lion on a crimson field, and the targaryens with a blood-red three-headed dragon on a black field, with the house sigils even becoming characters of themselves. when you see a banner of three black dogs on a yellow field, for example, an avid fan may instantly recognize that of house clegane, or you may catch a glimpse of a banner of a golden rose on a green field and know that's for house tyrell. and among the four noble houses, the most popular characters are daenerys targaryen, who is instantly recognizable with her silver hair; tyrion lannister with an iconic wit and attitude perfectly summarized in his well-known phrase, "i drink and i know things", arya stark the adventurous tomboy who becomes a terrifying assassin, and jon snow a globally beloved heartthrob; with other fan favorites being from some of the lesser-known and smaller houses and even from beyond the wall like tormund giantsbane the wildling raider, the before mentioned khal drogo, brienne of tarth, oberyn martell of house martell, olenna tyrell and her granddaughter margaery tyrell of house tyrell.another reason game of thrones is so wildly popular is how unpredictable the characters' fates become. the series has become widely known as one where few characters are guaranteed to live through the end of the eight seasons. (knight) even though the final episode of the game of thrones tv series, many other characters meet their fates in one way or the other. some characters are resigned to a simple hanging off-screen or even tragically and graphically being burned to death after a false prophecy misled another character. the many deaths kept many viewers hooked by the burning question, "will so-and-so die?" finally, one of the draws of the show being so beloved is the setting and music used during the episodes. the central locations of westeros and essos are filled with incredible amounts of lore and provide an extraordinary sense of life to the world. the house of the undying; a spire whose insides itself become a mind-bending labyrinth, harrenhal, the ruins of a castle whose very stone walls were melted by dragon fire like ice on a hot day, the intimidating ice wall of the north that is maintained by old forgotten magics to keep out the white walkers/others and wildlings beyond the walls; not a single location is placed wastefully; every name on the map and said by characters in passing providing a key ingredient to a living and breathing world with some locations being instantly recognizable, like the red keep of kings landing; or the elegantly terrifying moon door in high hall of the eyrie. then critically crucial to creating the emotions and atmosphere for the show is the music created by ramin djawadi; every scene is highlighted and enhanced by iconic scores like "the rains of castamere" used during the infamous red wedding; and the haunting "light of the seven" during the explosion of the sept of baelor. the music beautifully and expertly enhances the flavor of the scenes viewed by the audience, and even giving an additional flavor for what may be happening on-screen; with pounding drums enhancing on-screen, adrenaline-filled battles, or soft violin stings expressing the grief and sorrow of a character. every moment utilizes sound and on some occasions the lack of sound to convey key elements of a character's motivations, their plans, or even calling back to a prior episode.in conclusion; through the masterful craftmanship of excellent characters, fantastic world lore, and score provided through the show; the game of thrones series written by george r. r. martin and the accompanying tv series co-created by david benioff and d. b. weiss is one of the best epic-fantasy stories of all time; and certainly should snag a place on everyone's "must watch" list at some point.
